com.ikueb.revemap

Class EnumMapUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikueb.revemap.EnumMapUtils

  • public final class EnumMapUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    An utilities class to handle enum-related Maps.

    • Method Detail

      • doMap

        private static <T,K,V> java.util.Map<K,V> doMap(java.util.Set<T> set,
                                                java.util.function.Function<T,K> keyMapper,
                                                java.util.function.Function<T,V> valueMapper,
                                                boolean checkDuplicateKeys)
        Create a Map by applying key and value mappers to the Set.

        The merge function used to resolve collisions between values associated with the same key picks the later one.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the input Set type.
        K - the required key type.
        V - the required value type.
        Parameters:
        set - the Set to stream on.
        keyMapper - the Function to use for mapping keys of type K from the Set's elements.
        valueMapper - the Function to use for mapping values of type V from the Set's elements.
        checkDuplicateKeys - true if a strict check on duplicate keys is required, by comparing the resulting Map.size() with set.size().
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings K → V.
        See Also:
        Collectors.toMap(Function, Function, java.util.function.BinaryOperator)

      • validateArguments

        private static void validateArguments(java.lang.Object... args)
        This method exists solely to throw IllegalArgumentException instead of NullPointerException, when encountering null arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments to check for null.

      • convertToEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<E,java.util.Set<T>> convertToEnumMap(java.lang.Class<E> forEnum,
                                                                                                 java.util.Map<T,E> map)
        Reverses the T → E mappings of Map<T, E> while considering the possibility of duplicate E → T mappings. As such, the values of the resulting Map are of type Set <T>.

        Implementation note: the resulting map is an instance of EnumMap, and the values' Set are accumulated with Collectors.toSet().

        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the source Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        forEnum - the enum to represent.
        map - the Map with mappings T → E.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings E → Set<T>.
        See Also:
        convertToSimpleEnumMap(Map), Collectors.groupingBy(Function, java.util.stream.Collector), Collectors.toSet()

      • convertToSimpleEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<E,T> convertToSimpleEnumMap(java.util.Map<T,E> map)
        Reverses the T → E mappings of Map<T, E> without considering the possibility of duplicate E → T mappings. As such, the values of the resulting Map are of type T, with mappings streamed later overriding the earlier ones.

        Implementation note: the resulting map is an instance of EnumMap.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the source Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        map - the Map with mappings T → E.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings E → T.
        See Also:
        convertToEnumMap(Class, Map)

      • createEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<E,T> createEnumMap(java.lang.Class<E> forEnum,
                                                                               java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper)
        Creates a Map with mappings E → T, where values are derived using a Function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        forEnum - the enum to represent.
        enumMapper - the Function to use to derive the values for the resulting Map.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings E → T.
        See Also:
        createEnumMap(Set, Function)

      • createEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<E,T> createEnumMap(java.util.Set<E> enumSet,
                                                                               java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper)
        Creates a Map with mappings E → T, where values are derived using a Function.

        Implementation note: the resulting map is an instance of EnumMap.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumSet - the Set of enum to represent.
        enumMapper - the Function to use to derive the values for the resulting Map.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings E → T.

        Parameters:

      • createReverseEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<T,E> createReverseEnumMap(java.lang.Class<E> forEnum,
                                                                                      java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper)
        Creates a Map with mappings T → E, where the keys are mapped using a Function.

        Implementation note: the resulting map is an instance of HashMap.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        forEnum - the enum to represent.
        enumMapper - the Function to use for mapping the Map's keys.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings T → E.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if the enumMapper produces duplicate keys.
        See Also:
        createReverseEnumMap(Set, Function)

      • createReverseEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<T,E> createReverseEnumMap(java.util.Set<E> enumSet,
                                                                                      java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper)
        Creates a Map with mappings T → E, where the keys are mapped using a Function.

        Implementation note: the resulting map is an instance of HashMap.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumSet - the Set of enum to represent.
        enumMapper - the Function to use for mapping the Map's keys.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings T → E.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if the enumMapper produces duplicate keys.
        See Also:
        modifyReverseEnumMap(Set, Function, Map)

      • createReverseEnumMap

        public static <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,E> createReverseEnumMap(java.lang.Class<E> forEnum)
        Creates a Map of enums as values and their Enum.toString() representation as keys.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        forEnum - the enum to represent.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings String → E.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if E's Object.toString() produces duplicate keys.
        See Also:
        createReverseEnumMap(Set)

      • createReverseEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<T,E> createReverseEnumMap(java.util.Map<E,T> map)
        Reverses the E → T mappings of map.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        map - the Map to derive the mappings from.
        Returns:
        a Map with mappings T → E.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if there is more than one E → T mapping, producing duplicate keys.

      • createReverseEnumMap

        public static <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<java.lang.String,E> createReverseEnumMap(java.util.Set<E> enumSet)
        Creates a Map of enums as values and their Enum.toString() representation as keys.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumSet - the Set of enum to represent.
        Returns:

        Throws:

        See Also:
        createReverseEnumMap(Set, Function)

      • modifyReverseEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<T,E> modifyReverseEnumMap(java.lang.Class<E> forEnum,
                                                                                      java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper,
                                                                                      java.util.Map<T,E> result)
        Modifies a Map by putting mappings T → E, where keys are derived using a Function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        forEnum - the enum to represent.
        enumMapper - the Function to use for mapping the Map's keys.
        result - the Map to put the mappings to.
        Returns:
        the result Map.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if the enumMapper produces duplicate keys.
        See Also:
        modifyReverseEnumMap(Set, Function, Map)

      • modifyReverseEnumMap

        public static <T,E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> java.util.Map<T,E> modifyReverseEnumMap(java.util.Set<E> enumSet,
                                                                                      java.util.function.Function<E,T> enumMapper,
                                                                                      java.util.Map<T,E> result)
        Modifies a Map by putting mappings T → E, where keys are derived using a Function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the key type of the resulting Map.
        E - the enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumSet - the Set of enum to put.
        enumMapper - the Function to use for mapping the Map's keys.
        result - the Map to put the mappings to.
        Returns:
        the result Map.
        Throws:
        EnumMapUtils.DuplicateKeysException - if the enumMapper produces duplicate keys.
